nl.inl.blacklab.search

Class Kwic

  • java.lang.Object
    • nl.inl.blacklab.search.Kwic

  • public class Kwic
extends Object
    A "keyword in context" for a hit (left context, hit text, right context). The Hits class matches this to the Hit. This object may be converted to a Concordance object (with XML strings) by calling Kwic.toConcordance().

    • Constructor Detail

      • Kwic

        public Kwic(List<Annotation> annotations,
            List<String> tokens,
            int matchStart,
            int matchEnd)
        Construct a Kwic object
        Parameters:
        annotations - What annotations are stored in what order for this Kwic (e.g. word, lemma, pos)
        tokens - the contents
        matchStart - where the match starts, in word positions
        matchEnd - where the match ends, in word positions

      • Kwic

        public Kwic(DocContentsFromForwardIndex fragment,
            int matchStart,
            int matchEnd)
        Construct a Kwic object
        Parameters:
        fragment - the content fragment to make the Kwic from
        matchStart - where the match starts, in word positions
        matchEnd - where the match ends, in word positions

      • tokens

        public List<String> tokens(Annotation annotation)
        Get all values for a single annotation for all the tokens in the hit's context fragment.
        Parameters:
        annotation - the annotation to get
        Returns:
        the values of this annotation for all tokens

      • toConcordance

        public Concordance toConcordance()
        Convert this Kwic object to a Concordance object. This produces XML consisting of <w> tags. The words are the text content of the tags. The punctuation is between the tags. The other annotations are attributes of the tags.
        Returns:
        the Concordance object

      • toConcordance

        public Concordance toConcordance(boolean produceXml)
        Convert this Kwic object to a Concordance object. This may either consist of only words and punctuation, or include the XML tags containing the other annotations as well, depending on the parameter.
        Parameters:
        produceXml - if true, produces XML. If false, produces human-readable text.
        Returns:
        the Concordance object

      • annotations

        public List<Annotation> annotations()
        Get the annotations in the order they occur in the context array.
        Returns:
        the annotations
